intro: Tephrosia rheedei, commonly known as the African blue pea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, blue or violet flowers. Tephrosia rheedei is often grown for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures. Its seeds are sometimes used in local cuisines and medicinal practices.
